# WhereWasI Landing Page Implementation Plan

> **For Claude:** REQUIRED SUB-SKILL: Use superpowers:executing-plans to implement this plan task-by-task.

**Goal:** Create a multi-language landing page for the WhereWasI iOS app, reusing the FitnessStory build system.

**Architecture:** Static HTML landing page generated by Python build script from JSON locale files. Same structure as FitnessStory: build.py reads locales/*.json, generates index.html for each language, creates sitemap.xml.

**Tech Stack:** HTML5, CSS3, Vanilla JavaScript, Python 3 (build script)

---

## Task 1: Create Directory Structure

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/` (directory)
- Create: `WhereWasI/css/` (directory)
- Create: `WhereWasI/js/` (directory)
- Create: `WhereWasI/images/` (directory)
- Create: `WhereWasI/images/en/` (directory)
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/` (directory)
- Create: `WhereWasI/assets/app-store-badges/` (directory)
- Create: `WhereWasI/docs/` (directory)

**Step 1: Create all directories**

```bash
cd "/Users/willhsiao/Desktop/Watch App/MasaWata/MasaWata.net"
mkdir -p WhereWasI/{css,js,images/en/raw,locales,assets/app-store-badges,docs}
```

**Step 2: Verify structure**

```bash
ls -la WhereWasI/
```
Expected: css, js, images, locales, assets, docs directories

**Step 3: Copy shared assets from FitnessStory**

```bash
cp -r FitnessStory/assets/app-store-badges/* WhereWasI/assets/app-store-badges/
```

---

## Task 2: Create English Locale File

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/en.json`
- Reference: `FitnessStory/locales/en.json`

**Step 1: Create en.json with WhereWasI content**

Create `WhereWasI/locales/en.json`:

```json
{
  "lang": "en",
  "langName": "English",
  "appName": "WhereWasI",
  "meta": {
    "title": "WhereWasI - Remember Every Place You've Been",
    "description": "WhereWasI automatically tracks and organizes everywhere you go. Revisit your favorite spots, discover patterns in your daily life, and keep a private location journal.",
    "keywords": "location journal, places visited, location tracking, travel log, iOS app, privacy, location history, automatic tracking"
  },
  "nav": {
    "features": "Features",
    "screenshots": "Screenshots",
    "download": "Download",
    "faq": "FAQ"
  },
  "hero": {
    "title": "Remember Every Place You've Been",
    "description": "WhereWasI automatically tracks and organizes everywhere you go. Revisit your favorite spots, discover patterns in your daily life, and keep a private journal of your journey—all without lifting a finger.",
    "downloadAlt": "Download on the App Store"
  },
  "features": {
    "sectionTitle": "Powerful Features",
    "sectionSubtitle": "Everything you need to remember and explore your location history",
    "list": [
      {
        "id": "timeline",
        "icon": "clock",
        "title": "Your Life in Timeline",
        "description": "Scroll through a beautifully organized history of everywhere you've been. See your visits by day, week, or month—your life story unfolds automatically."
      },
      {
        "id": "statistics",
        "icon": "chart",
        "title": "Discover Your Patterns",
        "description": "Uncover insights about your daily life. See your most visited places, time spent at each location, and how your routines evolve over time."
      },
      {
        "id": "map",
        "icon": "map",
        "title": "Your World at a Glance",
        "description": "View all your visits plotted on an interactive map. Zoom out to see everywhere life has taken you, or zoom in to explore a single neighborhood."
      },
      {
        "id": "privacy",
        "icon": "shield",
        "title": "Your Data, Your Device",
        "description": "All location data stays securely on your iPhone and your personal iCloud. Nothing is ever sent to external servers. Your journey remains yours alone."
      }
    ]
  },
  "screenshots": {
    "sectionTitle": "See It In Action",
    "sectionSubtitle": "Beautiful design meets powerful functionality"
  },
  "download": {
    "title": "Start Remembering Today",
    "description": "Free to download. Your location journal begins the moment you install. No account required—just you, your iPhone, and the places you go.",
    "platforms": "Available on iPhone and iPad"
  },
  "faq": {
    "sectionTitle": "Frequently Asked Questions",
    "sectionSubtitle": "Everything you need to know about WhereWasI",
    "list": [
      {
        "question": "How does WhereWasI track my location?",
        "answer": "WhereWasI uses iOS location services to detect when you arrive and leave places. It runs efficiently in the background without draining your battery."
      },
      {
        "question": "Is my location data private?",
        "answer": "Absolutely. All data is stored locally on your device and synced only to your personal iCloud account. We never see or store your location data on any external servers."
      },
      {
        "question": "Can I edit or delete visits?",
        "answer": "Yes! You have full control. Edit visit times, merge duplicate places, add notes, or delete any visits you don't want to keep."
      },
      {
        "question": "Does it drain my battery?",
        "answer": "No. WhereWasI uses Apple's power-efficient significant location change APIs, designed to minimize battery impact while still capturing your visits accurately."
      }
    ]
  },
  "privacy": {
    "title": "Your Privacy Matters",
    "description": "WhereWasI keeps all your location data on your device and your personal iCloud account. Your travels are never shared with us or any third parties.",
    "link": "Read our Privacy Policy"
  },
  "footer": {
    "appStore": "App Store",
    "privacyPolicy": "Privacy Policy",
    "termsOfService": "Terms of Service",
    "copyright": "© 2025 WhereWasI. All rights reserved."
  }
}
```

**Step 2: Verify JSON is valid**

```bash
python3 -c "import json; json.load(open('WhereWasI/locales/en.json')); print('Valid JSON')"
```
Expected: "Valid JSON"

---

## Task 3: Create Build Script

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/build.py`
- Reference: `FitnessStory/build.py`

**Step 1: Create build.py adapted for WhereWasI**

Create `WhereWasI/build.py` - a simplified version of FitnessStory's build script with:
- 14 languages support
- WhereWasI-specific HTML template (4 features, no promo banner, no testimonials)
- Sitemap generation
- App Store ID: 6758056060

(Full code in implementation - approximately 800 lines adapting FitnessStory/build.py)

**Step 2: Test build script runs**

```bash
cd "/Users/willhsiao/Desktop/Watch App/MasaWata/MasaWata.net/WhereWasI"
python3 build.py
```
Expected: Generates index.html and sitemap.xml

**Step 3: Verify generated HTML**

```bash
head -50 index.html
```
Expected: Valid HTML with WhereWasI title and meta tags

---

## Task 4: Create CSS Stylesheet

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/css/style.css`
- Reference: `FitnessStory/css/style.css`

**Step 1: Copy and adapt FitnessStory CSS**

Copy FitnessStory's style.css and modify:
- Remove promo-banner styles (not needed)
- Remove testimonials styles (not needed initially)
- Update color variables if needed (based on app icon colors)
- Keep: header, hero, features, screenshots, download, faq, privacy, footer styles

**Step 2: Verify CSS file exists**

```bash
ls -la WhereWasI/css/style.css
```
Expected: File exists with reasonable size (15-20KB)

---

## Task 5: Create JavaScript

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/js/main.js`
- Reference: `FitnessStory/js/main.js`

**Step 1: Copy and adapt FitnessStory JavaScript**

Copy FitnessStory's main.js and modify:
- Remove promo banner countdown code
- Keep: screenshot gallery, language dropdown, smooth scrolling, FAQ accordion, scroll animations

**Step 2: Verify JS file exists**

```bash
ls -la WhereWasI/js/main.js
```
Expected: File exists

---

## Task 6: Add Placeholder Images

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/images/WhereWasI.png` (placeholder)
- Create: `WhereWasI/images/en/title.jpg` (placeholder)
- Create: `WhereWasI/images/en/timeline.jpg` (placeholder)
- Create: `WhereWasI/images/en/statistics.jpg` (placeholder)
- Create: `WhereWasI/images/en/map.jpg` (placeholder)
- Create: `WhereWasI/images/en/privacy.jpg` (placeholder)

**Step 1: Copy FitnessStory images as placeholders**

```bash
cp FitnessStory/images/Fitness\ Story.png WhereWasI/images/WhereWasI.png
cp FitnessStory/images/en/title.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/title.jpg
cp FitnessStory/images/en/dashboard.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/timeline.jpg
cp FitnessStory/images/en/graphs.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/statistics.jpg
cp FitnessStory/images/en/fitness-map.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/map.jpg
cp FitnessStory/images/en/storyline.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/privacy.jpg
```

**Step 2: Copy screenshot gallery placeholders**

```bash
cp FitnessStory/images/en/action-dashboard-calendar.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/action-timeline.jpg
cp FitnessStory/images/en/action-fitness-map.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/action-map.jpg
cp FitnessStory/images/en/action-storyline.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/action-visits.jpg
cp FitnessStory/images/en/action-analysis-benchmark.jpg WhereWasI/images/en/action-statistics.jpg
```

**Step 3: Verify images exist**

```bash
ls -la WhereWasI/images/en/
```
Expected: title.jpg, timeline.jpg, statistics.jpg, map.jpg, privacy.jpg, action-*.jpg

---

## Task 7: Run Full Build and Test

**Step 1: Run build**

```bash
cd "/Users/willhsiao/Desktop/Watch App/MasaWata/MasaWata.net/WhereWasI"
python3 build.py
```
Expected: Success message, generates index.html and sitemap.xml

**Step 2: Verify all files generated**

```bash
ls -la
```
Expected: index.html, sitemap.xml, robots.txt

**Step 3: Open in browser to verify**

```bash
open index.html
```
Expected: Landing page renders with placeholder content

## Task 8: Create Remaining Locale Files

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/zh-Hans.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/zh-Hant.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/ja.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/ko.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/fr.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/de.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/es.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/pt.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/it.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/ru.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/hi.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/id.json`
- Create: `WhereWasI/locales/vi.json`

**Step 1: Copy en.json as template for each language**

For each language, create locale file with translated content. Can use FitnessStory translations as reference for common phrases.

**Step 2: Run build with all locales**

```bash
python3 build.py
```
Expected: Generates 14 index.html files (root + 13 language subdirectories)

**Step 3: Verify language directories created**

```bash
ls -d */
```
Expected: zh-Hans/, zh-Hant/, ja/, ko/, fr/, de/, es/, pt/, it/, ru/, hi/, id/, vi/

---

## Task 9: Create CLAUDE.md

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/CLAUDE.md`

**Step 1: Create CLAUDE.md with build instructions**

```markdown
# CLAUDE.md

## Build Command

\`\`\`bash
python3 build.py
\`\`\`

Generates 14 localized HTML pages and updates sitemap.xml.

## Architecture

Same as FitnessStory - static multi-language landing page with Python build system.

## Key Files

- `build.py` - Generates HTML from locale JSON files
- `locales/*.json` - Translation files (14 languages)
- `css/style.css` - Shared styles
- `js/main.js` - Gallery, dropdowns, animations

## Adding Images

1. Save app icon to `images/WhereWasI.png`
2. Save screenshots to `images/en/` with names:
   - `title.jpg` (hero image)
   - `timeline.jpg`, `statistics.jpg`, `map.jpg`, `privacy.jpg` (features)
   - `action-*.jpg` (gallery screenshots)
3. Optimize: 660px width, JPEG quality 85
```

---

## Task 10: Create robots.txt

**Files:**
- Create: `WhereWasI/robots.txt`

**Step 1: Create robots.txt**

```
User-agent: *
Allow: /

Sitemap: https://masawata.net/WhereWasI/sitemap.xml
```

---

## Task 11: Final Verification and Commit

**Step 1: Run final build**

```bash
cd "/Users/willhsiao/Desktop/Watch App/MasaWata/MasaWata.net/WhereWasI"
python3 build.py
```

**Step 2: Verify all pages load**

```bash
open index.html
open ja/index.html
open zh-Hans/index.html
```
Expected: All pages render correctly with proper translations

**Step 3: Commit all files**

```bash
cd "/Users/willhsiao/Desktop/Watch App/MasaWata/MasaWata.net"
git add WhereWasI/
git commit -m "feat: Add WhereWasI landing page with 14-language support"
```

---

## Post-Implementation: Replace Placeholder Images

When real images are available:

1. Replace `images/WhereWasI.png` with actual app icon
2. Replace `images/en/*.jpg` with actual screenshots
3. Optimize images (660px width, JPEG quality 85)
4. Run `python3 build.py` to regenerate
5. Commit changes
